column4: you can use gparted. however always keep in mind that resizing / messing with partitions can be dangerous and you should have backups.
also, for that matter, the ubuntu installer itself can make the space for you (it calls parted to do that)
I was trying to install on a RAID array, and gparted only shows the two individual hard drives.
I've used gparted with great success on the single hard drive in my laptop, however.
